swfscAirDAS 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Aerial DAS sightings

Source: R/airdas_sight.R
airdas_sight.Rd

Extract sightings and associated information from aerial DAS data

airdas_sight(das.df)

Arguments

das.df

data frame; processed aerial DAS data.. TODO

Value

Data frame with one row for each species for each sighting. Associated information (observer, species, etc.) is extracted from Data# columns into as specified in Details. Other columns from das.df will be included in the output

Details

This function requires the following event codes:

Marine mammal sighting codes: "S" (first sighting) and "s" (resighting); turtle sighting code: "t"; additional sighting information: "1"

See ... todo (link to pdf) more info

A 'standard sighting' (std_sight in output data frame) means it was by ObsL, ObsB, or ObsR

This function assumes the following

InformationMammal sightingTurtle sightingNew column name
Sighting numberData1sight_no
ObserverData2Data1obs
Declination angleData3Data2angle_declination
Group size (best estimate)Data4NAtodo
Species code 1Data5Data3todo
Species code 2Data6NAtodo
Species code 3Data7NAtodo
Turtle size (ft)NAData4todo
Travel direction (deg)NAData5todo
Tail visible?NAData6todo

Examples

y <- system.file("airdas_sample.das", package = "swfscAirDAS")
y.proc <- airdas_process(y)

airdas_sight(y.proc)
